Description: Papyrus (P. Malcolm) written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto and Greek docket: 24 ll. of document A, Greek docket below it, and beginning of 16 ll. of document B. Lease of a share of funerary property and endowments for 3 years in lieu of interest on a loan (antichresis). On verso, two red circular stamp marks. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Date. year 39 Paophi 18 of Ptol. Euergetes II = BC. 132. Nov. 11".
Curator's comments: Translated in part by Revillout, Notice des papyrus demotiques archaiques 1896 pp.328-9. A lease of 1/12 share of certain revenues for 3 years in lieu of interest on a loan(antichresis). Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Gill, A.K. 2019. The hieratic ritual books of Pawerem (P. BM EA 10252 and P. BM EA 10081) from the late 4th century BC. Studien zur spätägyptischen Religion 25. Wiesbaden, p. 6 (for acquisition history).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (45942) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/45942)
Martin 2009 / Demotic Papyri from the Memphite Necropolis (P Dem. Memphis) (110-35.)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass (warped) Sandwich: board Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir T J Malcolm
